definition: to take part in/to participate/to join/to attend/to counsel/unequal/varied/irregular/uneven/not uniform/abbr. for 參議院|参议院 Senate, Upper House
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)

sentences.english: All non-Nepalese students enrolled at any of Hong Kong's universities are eligible to participate in the contest.
sentences.chinese: 所有非尼泊爾裔香港註冊大學學生均可參加。

sentences.english: They must have strong longings that lures them to attend MEC.
sentences.chinese: 他們一定有很強烈的渴望促使他們參加英語角。

sentences.english: A decade ago I might have attended one of Whitney’s seminars (if I could have afforded it).
sentences.chinese: 十年前我就應該參加Whitney的研討班的。

sentences.english: The first season took place in nineteen ninety-six.
sentences.chinese: 第一個賽季參加了96年的地方。

sentences.english: Thaksin and his wife, Pojaman, were in Beijing until Sunday for the opening of the Olympics.
sentences.chinese: 他信夫婦在北京參加奧運開幕式，一直逗留到星期天。

sentences.english: Each class elects two students to represent them on the School Council.
sentences.chinese: 每班選出兩個學生代表參加學生會。

sentences.english: My extracurricular activities include the Math and Drama Clubs.
sentences.chinese: 我的課餘活動包括參加數學興趣小組和戲劇社。

sentences.english: But Ryan Reser of the U.S. judo team has never been to the Olympics.
sentences.chinese: 但是這位美國柔道選手以前從來沒有參加過奧運比賽。

sentences.english: Now, more than 60 percent of kindergarteners attend for a full day.
sentences.chinese: 而現在，超過百分之六十的幼兒參加了全託。

sentences.english: Muammar al-Qaddafi, making his first appearance despite 40 years in power.
sentences.chinese: 這也是卡扎菲執政40年來首次參加聯大會議。

sentences.english: His idea of fun was to fly to Thailand to fight in a kickboxing tournament.
sentences.chinese: 他的想法就是去泰國參加跆拳錦標賽。

sentences.english: One on offer . In India the poor, proportionately, are more likely to vote.
sentences.chinese: 按比例來說，印度的窮人比中產階級更樂於參加投票。

sentences.english: Many world famous tennis players will take part in this tournament.
sentences.chinese: 多位世界知名的網球手會參加這項賽事。

sentences.english: After he graduated, he joined the army and devoted himself to making his motherland safe.
sentences.chinese: 畢業之後他參加了部隊，獻身於保衛祖國。

sentences.english: After school I usually attend a club.
sentences.chinese: 剛學後我通常參加俱樂部。

sentences.english: Have a bright shape, lively & open, auto fans, a member of amateur racing car organization.
sentences.chinese: 形象陽光，活潑開朗，喜愛汽車，參加業餘賽車隊。

definition: to exercise/to move about/to operate/to use connections (personal influence)/loose/shaky/active/movable/activity/campaign/maneuver/behavior/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
to compete/to take part in a competition
to sign up/to enter one's name/to apply/to register/to enroll/to enlist
the scene (of a crime, accident etc)/(on) the spot/(at) the site
student/member of an institution of learning/officer cadet
plan/project/program/to plan/to map out/CL:個|个[ge4],項|项[xiang4]
